ovdesc.p: This file contains the cheque details for those cheques that have been processed through the cheque collection processing.

The cheque collection processing is triggered off by setting the relevant parameter fields in the ACCOUNT.PARAMETER file that are used to specify a list of transaction codes that must invoke the processing related to depositing, collecting or returning cheques.
The process is described as under:

When the cheques have cleared or been returned it will be possible to manually update the status of every cheque on the CHEQUE.COLLECTION file or manually update the status an entire batch or partial batch of cheques through the CHEQUE.BATCH application.

As and when the cheques have cleared or been returned the CHEQUE.COLLECTION application will be used to post the cleared cheques from the suspense accounts to the client accounts on collection or from the collection suspense to the returned suspense on return of cheques.
In the case where the collection is handled with a data file it will be possible for the users to process the cheque collections via GTS.
It will be possible to specify a charge associated with cheques that have cleared or returned at both a batch level and an individual cheque level.
The currency of the cheque and the credit account should be the same.
Accounting rules:
Cheque is presented for deposit:
DR Cheque Clearing			CR Collection Suspense A/c
Forward Entry:
CR Actual Account
Optional Charge & Tax entries
Cheque has been collected:
DR Collection Suspense A/c		CR Actual Account
Raise any Charges & Tax entries
Delete all the forward entry
Cheque has been returned:
DR Collection Suspense A/c		CR Return Suspense A/c
Raise any Charges & Tax entries
Delete all the forward entry

desc.p: This field can be used to indicate a new status for the cheque. The field will be used to indicate the current status of the cheque. These statuses could any of the following:
DEPOSITED - When the cheque is initially deposited on an application it is updated with this status.
CLEARING - This status indicates that the cheque has now been batched on the CHEQUE.BATCH application record
CLEARED - This status indicates that the funds on the cheque have been collected.
RETURNED - This status indicates that the funds on the cheque could not be cleared and the cheque was returned

It is possible to change the status of a cheque mannually here if the cheque has not been batched. Once the cheque has been batched all changes of the status field must be handled through the CHEQUE.BATCH application.

If the status of the cheque is changed from 'DEPOSITED' to 'CLEARED' the system will automatically raise accounting entries to credit the original client account and debit the collection suspense account for the cheque amount. This action would also prompt the deletion of the forward entries created when the cheque was initially deposited. Any charges and/or tax amounts due will be raised.
No Input Allowed if the cheque collection record has been batched
If change allowed the valid changes to the status include DEPOSITED to CLEARED or DEPOSITED to RETURNED
Valid values are DEPOSITED, CLEARING, CLEARED or RETURNED

This field recognises three values viz., null, YES and NO.
When the CC record is not attached to any account as Collateral, the field is defaulted to 'null'.

When the field Application.ID in COLLATERAL application is populated with CQ.XXXXXX.XXXXX ( CQ.CUSTOMER. ACCOUNT), this field immediately defaults to 'YES' which enable it to link the CC record with the COLLATERAL record.
This defaulted value 'YES' shall be changed to 'NO' for delinking an already linked CC from the COLLATERAL record.
The only input that shall be manually input is 'NO'. The value can be input as 'NO' only if the previous value is 'YES'.
